title: A message to the community

embed.description: I try to stream as much as possible! - http://www.twitch.tv/davekthxbai What other League of Legends rap songs do YOU want to see? Leave your suggestions in a comment below! Download Link - https://soundcloud.com/flexizm/toxic Alt. Download Link - http://www.mediafire.com/download/99k9a01739bhr9h/Toxic.mp3.

body:
I'm sure we've all been through that phase where League seems like the best thing in the world at the moment but that moment gets ruined by a toxic player.Toxic players ruin the match i know but did you ever look at it from their perspective?.We all start level one not knowing what to build and ending up with an Hourglass on Jarvan like me for one and ending up level 30 this time knowing exactly how to dominate.But did you know that toxicity in the community comes from the community itself.Maybe your are upset about something and you lash out and release your anger in the game by verbally abusing people saying stuff like "Get cancer and die in hell" and many more comments.Even the least toxic people have been toxic a couple of times but there are those people that have it programmed into their systems from the very first time they got abused.You cant remove toxicity from League thats like getting rid of bullying schools you can't.What you can do is simply ignore them.Mute them.You can also help by giving a suggestion not a suggestion + an insult.Like "hey Thresh, can you  please ward the tri-bush" not go off at them like "GG no vision can you even ward thresh you moron".Its those tiny little things that can make the community a better place if u ask me.I know someone might comment saying "mute them scrub" but sometimes muting dosen't always just fix the problem.
Thanks for Listening!!

replies.body:
I hate the sentiment of these vids. Fight fire with fire? When did that ever work. Grow a thicker skin, mute the haters and take things a little less seriously. It sucks that the community is the way it is but you're not helping by contributing to it.  
  

The video isn't super relevant to your point though?
